sn14.15:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.
sn14.15:1.2: Now at that time Venerable Sāriputta was walking together with several mendicants not far from the Buddha.
sn14.15:1.3: Venerable Mahāmoggallāna was doing likewise, as were
sn14.15:2.1: Then the Buddha said to the mendicants,
sn14.15:2.2: “Mendicants, do you see Sāriputta walking together with several mendicants?”
sn14.15:2.4: “All of those mendicants have great wisdom.
sn14.15:2.5: Do you see Moggallāna walking together with several mendicants?”
sn14.15:2.7: “All of those mendicants have great psychic power.
sn14.15:2.8: Do you see Kassapa walking together with several mendicants?”
sn14.15:2.11: Do you see Anuruddha walking together with several mendicants?”
sn14.15:2.14: Do you see Puṇṇa son of Mantāṇī walking together with several mendicants?”
sn14.15:2.16: “All of those mendicants are Dhamma speakers.
sn14.15:2.17: Do you see Upāli walking together with several mendicants?”
sn14.15:2.19: “All of those mendicants are experts in monastic law.
sn14.15:2.20: Do you see Ānanda walking together with several mendicants?”
sn14.15:2.22: “All of those mendicants are very learned.
sn14.15:2.23: Do you see Devadatta walking together with several mendicants?”
sn14.15:2.25: “All of those mendicants have corrupt wishes.
sn14.15:3.1: Sentient beings join together and converge because of an element.
sn14.15:3.2: Those who have inferior convictions join together and converge with those who have inferior convictions.
sn14.15:3.3: Those who have good convictions join together and converge with those who have good convictions.
sn14.15:5.1: and also in the present, sentient beings join together and converge because of an element.
sn14.15:5.2: Those who have inferior convictions join together and converge with those who have inferior convictions.
sn14.15:5.3: Those who have good convictions join together and converge with those who have good convictions.”
